parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tire tread separation can cause loss of vehicle control, accidents, and damage to the vehicle, which can lead to injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: making it difficult to control the vehicle
vibration or shaking of the vehicle
damage to surrounding components such as wheel wells

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Head Gasket Failure in 3.8L Ford Engines
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the head gasket can cause engine damage, overheating, and loss of power, leading to a potential breakdown or accident.
A loose battery connection can cause the engine to shut off, leading to a loss of power and potential accidents.
symptoms: especially when driving through puddles at slow speeds.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Rust and leakage in the oil pan can cause engine damage, oil loss, and potentially lead to engine failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Cylinder Damage due to Inadequate Coolant Maintenance
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure to add the recommended chemical additive to the coolant system can cause cylinder damage, leading to engine failure and potential breakdowns.
The premature failure of the E4OD transmission can cause sudden loss of power, stalling, or difficulty shifting gears, leading to accidents, inconvenience, and costly repairs.
Corrosion and leaks in the fuel tank can cause fuel to leak onto the road, creating a fire hazard, and can also lead to engine stalling, which can cause accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: leaks under the front restraining strap.
